title: Wifi unreliable on hardware makes app seem bugged
text:
Update to the fourth power: app is solid for me but camera wifi has significant issues. Wifi disconnects and reconnects to my network about once every 5 minutes. This wifi bug is a long standing issue and I really hope they fix it as the hardware misses visits during this disconnect/reconnect. 

Update cubed: delete and reinstall app to fix the current set of bugs 🐛 

Another update: I have to power cycle these lights every few weeks or so else they become unreliable. In order to pick up night time activity, the AI sensitivity must be turned up extremely high. Clean spider webs 🕸 on a very regular basis else you’ll both miss alerts and get ghost alerts. 

Below is my old review. I’ve since added two more lights and have turned on AI for alerts which have changed the entire way these cameras sense people and cars. There is a lot of configuration available for the AI alerts and tweaking them all takes time!
The night sensitivity is distinctly less than daytime, but I’m still configuring AI so maybe I’ve yet to tune things in correctly. 
Kuna stopped alerting when holiday sounds have been added so I just have to keep checking the app to see if Halloween, Thanksgiving 🦃, or other holiday sounds have been added. 
Each camera style is slightly different in its night time lighting and glare. The original square camera probably has the worst glare of them all even with the additional glare blocks added, the best at lighting is probably the huge swooping light with glass that isn’t completely fogged. 
Overall great replacement for door lights!
—-
I installed the first one on the back door. Initially I received a lot of false alarms but it was pretty clear from the video that my trees were setting it off. I turned down the sensitivity to 75% and almost all false positives immediately disappeared.

The tiny camera shade had to be swapped out for one that was in the included plastic bag; this greatly decreased night glare and increased the night distance and color quality of the light. 

After a month with the back yard light I installed one on the front door and it’s performed perfectly. I may have to adjust sensitivity for blowing plants but haven’t had to yet!

The light isn’t perfect but I love it for what it is. As always these cameras require good WiFi -outdoors- where they’re installed. Most problem installs are probably related to people not understanding WiFi signal quality. A repeater near the light -might- fix most of these problems (depending on the house!)

There is a quirk with notifications: alerts appear but then quickly disappear. Often I will only see an alert if I’m using my phone at the same time it shows up.

I love that these things are so stealthy. No one ever seems to notice that a camera is there until it’s too late — they’ve been captured on video! The automated greeting is a further deterrent. It usually startles them and leaves no doubt that their presence has been detected.  My only complaint, up until now, has been that there wasn’t an appropriate greeting for every situation. For my backyard, I wanted something very aggressive, because no one has any business being in my walled and gated (locked) backyard. title: Decent when it works
text:
Cameras go offline too often, even when a router is literally within 10 feet of a camera. Sometimes when they go offline, you have to manually re-add a camera which is horribly inconvenient, especially since the app doesn’t remember the settings you used when you last added the camera, so everything needs to be set again. I don’t know why a camera that has gone offline doesn’t remember its settings, but the only time it does remember and go back online on its own is when the power goes out. 

I’ve also had at least one issue where no recording was made, even though I received a notification. I could view the activity in real time, but for some reason no recording was ever made.

Kuna support is reachable, but they haven’t been able to offer a solution for any of the aforementioned problems. For $10/month (I have two cameras), the cost is steep given the issues. When I’m away from home on travel, if a camera goes offline, I’m out of luck until I return home, which defeats the purpose of having these.

There’s also no HomeKit support for Kuna products, nor IR for better vision at night. Overall, the product feels more like a beta than a refined solution at this point.

Originally wrote a review a couple of months ago and provided 2 stars. After months of the app/camera working approximately 10% of the time, I’ve down-graded my review from two stars to one.

The overall Kuna rating is currently 2.6, and that’s .6 higher than I’d give it. The customer service is great, but the app/camera is super unstable. Some days, we’ll get 35 notifications stating it has gone on and offline, and other days, it won’t go back online until we reset our WiFi or power off the camera at the source (which is a pain since it is on a short-term rental that we can’t access all the time). Many times, video footage also won’t fully download, so 25%+ of the footage becomes useless. I don’t think Kuna developed comprehensive enough technology to be able to support typical internet traffic and changes, and it would be great if they did some major upgrades so that the camera was more reliable.

title: It’ ok...
text: Customer service is great! I received a defective unit that was constantly going offline and the team quickly send me a replacement! The app is very easy to use! However, the notifications when someone is at the door is usually late to my phone. The microphone quality is great, but I have the issue that if a person at my front door starts talking while I am giving them a response through the mic, I will not be able to hear them.  The camera does not pick up motion at night very well even though I have my AI settings configured for the areas of detection. Overall, it is a good way to keep your home safe.I just wish the system will notify me as soon as it sees the car or individual during the day or night (since the device says that it is always connected to EXCELLENT wifi!).

title: Buggy
text: It's hard to rate the app independent of the product. My kuna keeps showing as offline- is it an app issue, product issue, network issue? On iPad, rotating to landscape view makes the bottom screen controls (sound alarm, play msg, hold to talk, turn light on/off) inaccessible. We also really need a remote reboot button. Many times I'll check on the house from work and the kuna is unresponsive. I have  to text my kids to turn the light switch off/on to reboot the kuna. I am thinking of pairing the kuna with a wemo switch so that I can just do it remotely. It would be nice if I could just do this from the app. As a product, it was easy to set up and I am looking forward to the app updates that will make this product even better.

title: OK, but features desperately needed
text:
I have had Kuna enabled cameras for years now and for the most part have been happy with them, but there has been a distinct lack of improvements. Kuna does not integrate with basically anything. IFTTT, nope. Alexa, not in a useful way. HomeKit, not a chance. SmartThings, Google Home, etc... You get the picture. 

When Kuna first came out they where ahead of the game, but they have fallen behind, way behind. Outside of some bug fixes, very little has been introduced to make it better, and it is now way behind it’s competitors. I don’t know what is going on, but worry they are on their way out, which would be disappointing as I like my doorbell camera. Just wish it could talk to literally anything else in my smart home setup.

title: Worst update ever!!!
text: I purchased two Toucan attachments so I wouldn’t have to replace my nice outdoor fixtures. The one for the front door always worked fine. The one for the back door constantly kept going offline. However, since the last update it isn’t keeping my videos for 14 days. I pay yearly. It has dropped my videos after 2 hours and 6 hours. Their customer service is horrible. They’re only available Monday thru Friday 9:00 to 5:00pm Central time REALLY???? REALLY!!! Security is 24/7. I’ve been told to delete the app then re-install etc...  How about you fix the glitch or return my fee for the unused months left on my contract with you. I’m truly disgusted with your customer service or should I say lack of customer service. I was considering replacing my Toucans with the Maximus security lights found in Costco. But now that I know there is no one to help when you need it why would I. Fix the problem!!!!!

title: Delayed notifications
text:
Works great when it works. Half the time it either have delayed notifications or completely missed triggers. Tried many times adjusting the motion sensors and going back and forth with tech support and still the same results. I even sent it back for a replacement and it still does the same thing. My wifi have strong signals with over 90mbps detected right at the light, so I know it's not my connection.

I wish the engineers can really work on those issues.
I more thing, I wish when I speak with someone over live recording that I it records my part of the conversation as well instead of just the person at the door. I would recommend this light to my friends and families but without the fixes I don't think I can do so currently. I hope Kuna is listening.

title: Awesome
text:
I’ve had Kuna for a while now with no subscription. I just paid for the service and couldn’t be happier! So many times my camera would go off in the middle of the night and I would wait too long to look at it and would lose the video. Now, with the subscription I’m finally seeing all the things I was missing. Thank god no intruders but have seen lots of wildlife passing by my camera through the night. Definitely worth the purchase for peace of mind.
I did have some initial problems after the update but realized that it was my mistake and all I needed to do was log out and sign back in and everything was golden again!👍

title: Extremely Happy
text: I love our Kuna porch light.  It gives us such peace of mind when we're out.  I love having both live view options, and video recordings.  I had a really good experience with Customer Service this past December when our beloved dog passed away.  We had spent hours her final morning in our front garden together and since our Kuna premium trial had ended, we didn't have any videos of the special moments.  Chris at Kuna received my request to help retrieve the videos and extended my trial another week.  I was able to retrieve the videos from my pup's last day and so many more.  I really appreciated his kindness during such a tough time.

title: Stylish but unreliable, to expensive for quality
text: Had high hopes, easy install, but daily issues of camera detection turning off. Sometimes when greeting comes on it’s 2-3 greetings play at same time ( max headroom, for those old enough to know who that is) have uninstalled and reinstalled app, killed power to light to reset daily. Motion activation still works but no camera, try to watch playback it tells me still recording, this is 30 mins later. Before you ask according to the app I have excellent signal and the light is less than 5 feet from the router. Online and phone help is little to no help, they tell me to do the exact same things I have already tried. Randomly it will come on and work as it’s supposed to but not a reliable source for extra home security

title: The camera is great but buyer BEWARE!
text: I bought two Kuna camera lights and two companion lights. So at first I was super thrilled about these as they look good and can stay powered on all the time if needed. BUT, there's always a but. They make you pay to keep the motion detections recordings. Otherwise they don't let you keep the recording for longer then 2 days. Then I have a new iPhone 7 Plus and the videos recordings are not able to be downloaded to your phone. Then I tried to share the same video and guess what, can't email, text or post to FB because the format is not compatible. Super lame of them. I bet if I paid a subscription then they would be able to be saved. Buyers beware I can barely utilize this product without paying subscription fees.

title: Def Worth It!
text:
If I could give 10 stars, I would.  Just ordered my second one.  Yes, there were issues with the video pixelation but they contacted me and confirmed it was an issue with the modem channel.  So, I’m good. 

The clarity is amazing. The level of sensitivity is great also (pickup movement as close as the porch or as far as cars driving down my street). 

I’ve actually witnessed an attempted burglary of my home. Was able to give him a piece of my mind and sound the alarm from the camera. It made the perp scatter. I was later able to distribute the video to neighbors quickly to inform them to be on the lookout.  Perfect!

title: Needs iOS 14/iPhone 12 update?
text:
The camera has worked well for years, though it’s not good with the live feature and talking to someone. It doesn’t seem to capture live motion and conversation at the same time. There’s always a delay.  

What I notice now is that the live camera isn’t working at all. Only the sound is coming through, but if there’s someone actually in front of the camera, you can’t see them. I noticed this more after Apple updated the operating system. I’ve uninstalled and reinstalled the camera, socket, WiFi connection, and the app on my phone. I still cannot get the live video to work properly.

title: This App Started Out GREAT, and Just Continues to Improve ! ! !
text:
A while ago a criminal was arrested & convicted of stealing our mail, (several packages), due directly to how well the KUNA system operated. 

The price is incredibly reasonable, especially considering everything it does, and how simple it is to operate. I was out of town, several states away, when a solicitor came to our front door.  Upon being alerted, I easily engaged them in a Back -n- Forth conversation.  As far as the solicitor knew I was inside my house, but to busy to come to the door.  "BTW",, I was also able to due this while in another country ! ! !

title: Going Downhill
text:
I used to be a huge supporter of Kuna cameras, recommending them to any one who would listen.  Just can’t recommend them any more.  All my recorded videos, regardless of when they were recorded, freeze around the ten second mark on playback but play fine when downloaded. 
     Customer support could not resolve the issue and closed out my case with a “will get back to you”.   Issue continues months later with no one getting back to me.   
   Another complaint, you can NOT simply change your email in your account.  You have to jump through hoops to simply change your email unlike Kuna’s competitors that simplify this process.

title: Definitely agree kuna needs to integrate!
text:
I have several kuna & toucan video cameras. Very disappointed they have not evolved into smart home devices.
The new wireless toucan cameras use a new toucan app that does actually work with Alexa, but sadly, the app will not connect with my old kuna/toucan wired cameras. 
There is no firmware update to make the old toucans work with the new wireless toucans, so if I purchase a new camera they will be on two different apps! 
Why not upgrade the kuna app to integrate with smart homes and be able to see both old and new cameras in one app? 
I guess that makes too much sense. Why try to make your customers happy?...Very disappointing 😩

title: Really amazing, until it wasn’t...
text:
So our first Kuna light would not connect to anything. Company graciously replaced it and our second unit worked fine. Was a few times it didn’t seem to work correctly but nothing too bad. Then we upgraded our WiFi network and now the unit won’t work. However I don’t think it has anything to do with our connection. The Kuna used to pick up 3 other WiFi networks from neighbors but now it simply says “cant fetch WiFi networks” 

Customer support is usually a hard to understand Asian person and they simply tell you to email a photo of the problem.. then they do nothing. So now my expensive camera is simply a regular light. Would’ve been a 4-5 star product. Now it’s worthless.

title: Needs Updating
text: If you aren’t bothered by the constant offline/online messages then you’ll definitely be annoyed at how long it takes the app to load the video feed (both live and recording). Most of the time the person has left the porch by time the video loads and that is assuming there isn’t horrendous graphical anomalies which occur on the phone app (iPhone 6S and the XS) or on the iPad. Their customer service never return my emails or support requests sent through the app. When I first got the camera it worked great for like a month and two years later I was dumb enough to get another for my garage. Don’t waste your money and invest in a better home security camera setup or even a RING.

title: Not great
text: purchased Kuna on June 13, 2017 (actually purchased three) and setup was easy. Worked great until I changed my WiFi SSID and that was it. Turns out the device uses the Bluetooth to connect first time to set up the WiFi connection. To my surprise, the Bluetooth stopped working and I was not able to communicate to the light to get the Wifi setup. Now I just have a really expensive light. Not sure when the Bluetooth stopped working but the warranty only covers the first 12 months. So I needed to make this discovery in the first twelve months or that was it. Called support and was told, "sorry, you are past the twelve months and there is nothing we can do". Really disappointed with the product and the support. I recommend the Ring at this point.

title: Mission impossible!!
text: After having installed for over a month i have nothing but issues, it doesn’t detect 100%, the motion light is useless, the customer service is joke, they keep giving you the runaround in circles repeating the same thing over and over again, they blame your router, the speed, channels, when in reality it has nothing to do with detecting, the funny thing is i have other things that are connected to my WIFI and i have absolutely no issues, by the way my router is about two feet away from the lantern, they just don’t want to admit that their product has flows and don’t even want to bother fixing it either.

title: The 2 hour free recording disappeared
text: I heard the motion sound went on then I went to the camera recorded playback and found nothing. I am not sure why now even the 2 hour recordings are gone. Do we have to get premium to view video history even within the 2hr period? I was able to see the videos before when I first installed the light/camera 2 years ago. Not sure what happened lately. My ring is as able to capture the cat walking by but not Kuna. Kuna only made the alarm sound but didn’t record video. Please fix this.

title: Works well for me but has some issues
text: I have 4 cameras and 3 companion lights operating for over 2 years. There have been some growing pains with the updates have generally brought improvements. There are some continuing annoyances: 1) periodically 2 of the 3 companion lights disconnect from their parent camera. This requires a complete reset of the companions and re-pairing with the parent. 2) sometimes there is significant latency between when a person is in the field of view (6 to 10 feet from the camera) and they are detected.  I have adjusted the parameters but the results only differed slightly. 3) Kuna promised HomeKit integration years ago but this failed to happen. :-(

title: Working again
text:
The app was down for a couple of days but is back up again. The app itself is vey good. It allows you to view live and trigger recording, speak through the cameras speaker or trigger a siren. 

It allows you to control the sensitivity of the detection, receive alerts and view recordings. In addition you have complete control of the lights. It also loads quickly. 

Most of the bad reviews sound like WiFi issues. You can’t run IP Video on a slow network. I had to upgrade my speed and add an extender.

title: Pretty Smart!
text: At first, my Kuna was sending me dozens of alerts on windy days (detected the trees moving). This was super annoying because I read that kuna was supposed to be "smart" and learn that it was a tree and not a person. Well, turns out you have to teach the kuna. after marking the clips as "not a person" the number of false alarm alerts went down. On a particularly windy day I didn't get a single alert. I walked in front of the kuna just to make sure it was actually on. Yep, kuna saw me as a person and had learned to ignore the trees! Pretty smart!

title: Unhappy user
text: I have owned the Kuna motion sensor light for a month and find that it has many problems. First off there is quite a delay from the time someone approaches your door till you receive a notification that someone is there. Additionally, Sometimes it does not even signal that someone has approached your door. Often when you do get a signal that someone has approached your door you cannot view the camera to see who is there because you get a message that the camera is busy. If you try to view the film recorded by the camera while the camera is busy the film is not available. By the time you get use of the camera again the person has already gone and you have no idea who is there.

title: Great product, but needs better optimization
text:
This is a fantastic product and is much better than any other security camera available. The ability to monitor from anywhere  with motion makes it one of the most enthralling products available.

However, I have noticed that when someone is at the door, and I try to view on my device, it momentarily says camera is busy. It wouldn't matter if you are away from home but if you are at home, it is crucial to be able to see the visitor. 

Also, for people that have multiples kuna's, there should be an option for the motion notification to display the exact location. Right now it says "someone is at the door"
And under that, it says the location, but it would be more convenient to have it as the main notification.

Other than that, this product works great.

title: Love the new Kuna AI
text:
I like how this picks up and notifies based on person or vehicle.  Looking forward to it getting smarter over time.  It would be great however if you could disable alerts for vehicles and keep enabled for persons, rather than bunching all alerts together.

By the time I'm able to open the app and start a manual recording, the 10 secs have passes so it doesn't catch the event.  Please have manual recordings grab 30 seconds before starting. I think this is enough time to get opened and start recording.

title: Love, love, love this
text: I did actually use this once to answer the door. So convenient!  Love being able to see when packages are delivered, when the cat sitter arrives when we're traveling and when my husband last walked the dog. I love the possibility of answering the door with the prerecorded male voice. Other fun things you can do with this: check to see if it's raining at home when you're away and post a video of yourself on Facebook falling on the ice.

title: Needs work and features
text:
I’ll start with the positive remark. This app works and alerts as needed and it very rarely does not work to the point of frustration. 
Now my criticism.
The load time from alert to full live feed needs to be sped up, I feel like people are sometimes walking away by the time I go live.
Needs casting options. It would be great if I could cast to my chromecast or Apple TV when I am waiting for a guest or service worker.
I may be a little out of place mentioning it here, but the Alexa skill does not alert on motion, I have mentioned that in the skill store.

title: Great product needs improvement
text:
There needs to be a way to just turn on or off the light without using an app or waving your hands. They also could make an Apple Smartwatch app that would allow you to do just this. As it is now it's more difficult to normally control than a normal light.  You can't just flip the switch. 

Flipping the switch as normal light requires an entire new internet connection to be established so that is not the answer as the cam is wanted 24/7.

title: Great so far.
text: The app and the light fixture have been great to date. I've had it since 3/1/16. The only thing that bugs me is that the video playback is not always instant. That may just be a problem with my internet connection. The notifications are on point, as soon as someone is at my door I get notified but I can't see what's happening instantly, sometimes it takes a few try's. Hopping for improvements soon. But so far it's a great product that could get even better.

title: Great at first, but very buggy
text: I’ve had 3 Kuna cameras for 1-2 years. They were great at first, but after about a year the oldest camera randomly stops recording motion and needs to be reset often. Sometimes the app wont load the videos even though I pay for the premium plan. None of the cameras capture motion reliably, even with the sensitivity very high. Lately the app shuts down whenever I try to switch between live streaming and videos.  The cameras and the app are too unreliable for the cost.

title: Not worth it
text:
We purchased 4 camera lights. Immediately we had issues with 1 that would keep disconnecting and not show video. I contacted support and had to have it replaced TWICE then another camera started giving us issues but only like 1 every few months so we just deal with it. 

As far as for the motion”... someone could walk by the camera, break into your car, steal stuff before you even got a notification. 

You can’t depend on these cameras to actually “capture” something. They’re only good for being able to look at a live stream of your view when you want.

title: Cost effective but not so great
text: If you want a little security and don't have big pockets then this is for you. It needs some work though as it is not what it seems. It misses motion often no matter the sensitivity level and alerts can be seconds to minutes. Example: I'm at work and on wifi and receive an alert that someone is at my door. I quickly open the app and click on the live camera. (A matter of 6seconds) Soon as the feed displayed, a car was already backing up. I watched the video it recorded and it was Jahova witnesses that stood at my door for prob 40 seconds. So this is what I mean by late alerts. I really can't complain though for the price.

title: This a great Device!
text: Not sure why there’s negative feedback. Must be from all the non-technical folks. Installing and setting up this device was sooooo easy. Down load the app, enter in your credentials, and pair your phone with the device. That’s it, nothing more!  Great image. There is a second of latency but that’s normal for most camera systems. Image quality is good too! The app is easy to use. Great product!

title: So close
text: The app is decent for me, it notifies the second someone comes to the door, but by the time it’s done loading when I want to see the person, they are leaving (like the mailman for example). Also I do not know if this is possible in a software update but when I talk to someone it needs to be dual duplex, it shuts off audio so I can’t hear their response, that’s one of the purposes of the cameras so it should work properly. It still comes in handy for me but has some major inconveniences that need to addressed.

title: System Sluggish
text:
We’ve been using Kuna for a few years now and love it!  Unfortunately we’ve noticed that the app - camera connection has been slow / sluggish. Often times I’ll get a notification someone came to my door after the fact.  Or the video feed will freeze.  I thought maybe increasing bandwidth with my service provider would help, which I did, but it hasn’t made a difference.  Is there a firmware update to fix this issue!?  I noticed it had also dropped WiFi connection / gone offline a few times for no reason as well. 

Th

title: Like new updates
text: Did notice less notifications thought it was learning my routine not sure it was update. Or if it's a good thing. I think this app is very good and so is the kuna. Tried the Arlo wireless but doesn't come close to kuna as far as app and hardware. Happy with purchase. Real like the way it gives us clip right from notification instead having to unlock phone then open app.

title: Terrific Customer Service
text:
I had a problem with my videos not clearing automatically and  contacted customer service.
David Smith contacted me back and upon checking found that there was a glitch in the system and that they will be working on an update to correct the problem.
David Smith stayed in contact with me until the update was posted and the problem resolved.

title: Slow. Went to hell.
text:
The shift from live to recorded used to take a second. Now that tranisition (either way takes up to ten seconds) . The whole live view takes longer to load, by far. 

For instance, the front yard camera used to send a beep notification, and I’d open the app and see the UPS guy walking away. Now, it doesn’t open before his truck is gone. 

Looks like kuna has given up. Too bad Costco supported them. $500 for crappy service - I’ll be sending a letter to my friends in Kirkland, and I’ll go wired on the cameras. Enough. These fools gave up.

title: Log-in Failure Since last IOS upgrade
text:
Unable to log in since Apple iPhone upgraded to IOS 13.3.1. It quits before it could log in. We are only able to view live footage on our old iPad with older operating system. We purchased 9 of these porch lights for our two homes. 

No upgrade available on Apple App Store .
I use to speak highly about Maximus Lights with camera, but not lately. I recommended these product  to dozens of friends😖.

title: Unable to reconnect to new WiFi
text: I followed every step to pair my security light, when I get to the point where my phone is next to the security light to add device and select device from the list as new device 1 (step 4), I continue the set up process however at this point the app crashes and it never gets to step 5. I’ve reset it numerous times by shutting power, I’ve also reset it by holding the reset button for 10seconds to no avail. I’m fearing that the circuit board my be bad at this point or the kuna app is glitchy.

title: Great Product with very nice app
text: I installed a Kuna Craftsman Bronze outdoor security light and camera. Install was easy as I was replacing an existing fixture (took me 25 min). Setup using the app was easy. App works great. My only suggestion is to include the "Play Message" button when the app is used in landscape mode (the live video image is larger when in landscape mode). That is quite easy to do so I hope they do it.

title: New Bug
text: Not sure what bugs you fixed with this new version but whatever you did caused a new bug. Now when I open the app there is a grey bar up top that says “No devices detected”. I have to tap the screen multiple times before the camera feeds show up. This makes it difficult for me to rapidly see what is going on around my house. Please fix ASAP.

title: Stay away
text: Sluggish is one word. If you bought a camera from these people go return it. Freezes sometimes, doesn’t record all the time, somehow when you turn the light on it makes it worse. Their AI program couldn’t tell a semi trailer from a dog and if you want to record you have to pay. No way to use it on the desktop, probably because they don’t want you to have the ability to stream it to your computer so you can save it on there, instead of using their garbage platform. Just my 2 cents.

title: Really slid in quality over last few years
text: I was enthralled with this a few years ago- wonderful video and audio quality, simple app, not glitchy. I moved, didn’t use for a few years, just moved again and was psyched to reinstall..... only to have this now cost money to use the same way (“premium” didn’t exist years ago!), the dusk to dawn light feature simply doesn’t work (yes I have all the latest firmware and app), and the video quality- despite my internet being 25x faster now- abysmal. So disappointed. Another startup down the toilet when they needed to monetize.

title: Meh
text: App is too slow. I get an alert but then when I open the app to check on my front door it often won’t load or takes so long that the individual is gone.   Customer service takes a long time to respond. Be prepared to try getting in touch multiple times.  When my issues were finally resolved I ended up getting another unit that didn’t work correctly.  I just deal with the issue now because trying to get another unit is far more frustrating.

title: Average. More control needed.
text:
The UI is a bit slow, but we are talking about wifi streaming HD video on a home network here. 
More granular access control is needed: need to be able to grant addition users control of cameras during defined times. Use case: regular weekly babysitter should be able to attend to door withou opening it during the week, but doesn't need notifications when off duty... feels like a MVP release, hope more functionality is on the way.

title: Absolute Garbage
text:
The cameras are a complete waste of money and this app is garbage. I installed three cameras and they haven’t worked right a single time. Every couple hours I have to reconnect them to this app. The live feed is pointless since it never loads. I’ve hit “update firmware” for each one and they won’t update.

I’ve boosted wifi signal for the cameras and perform exactly the same. This system amounts to a fake security camera/great digital door bell ringer.

I hope developers actually fix this garbage but no high hopes. Invest in a hardline system instead.

title: Monthly Fee is Ridiculously High
text: I have one light installed in my backyard, and it works well.  However, I have decided not to install one in the front yard due to the high monthly fee that Kuna charges.  $5.00 per month per light is outrageously high, when e-storage costs are so cheap.  Even the cost of Ring, $3.00, is too high, but it is still a much better deal.  If Kuna would lower their total monthly cost (for all lights, not just one) to match Ring’s cost of $3.00/month, then I’d probably recommend this product.

title: Needs Bluetooth headset support
text: I have 5 kuna coach at my place and 5 at my parents place.  Very happy with all features and functions.  Firmware need support for Bluetooth headset now.  When I view live, Audio does Not go to Bluetooth headset which is not the case from other competitors.  I also have Logi circles and Ring cameras all of which have this feature.  This is very handy in loud environments.  Kuna Devs, please add Bluetooth audio support.

title: Great
text:
I accidentally bought 2 cameras (eventually I’ll buy 2 dummies and move 1 of each to a new location).  Sometimes 1 camera detects motion but the other doesn’t.  They’re literally 3 feet apart and someone is standing right in the middle of them.  

For the most part the system works very well.  Between the two cameras, one of them will pick up just about anyone that comes to the door.

title: Fake notifications unless you pay
text:
If you don’t have the premium membership (which it doesn’t even tell you the cost until you sign up) it will send notifications at three in the morning saying ‘Someone came to the door!’, luckily I was awake and able to go on my phone, but there was no recordings.

The same thing happened a few days later and I wasn’t able to get to my phone in time.  Horrible app, if you got the unit.

I would suggest returning it unless you’re willing to pay the fee for the premium membership.

title: No Security Security camera
text:
Unbelievable! I hear the alarm but when I try to view it, it tells you “SORRY CAN’T PLAY RECORDING”.  Well, how do I know that I’m about to be burglarized? Most days I can’t view recordings even when I try to play the oldest recordings on display. Lately it’s so hard to view the playbacks bc it’s  distorted and the color kept changing.  And sometimes it doesn’t capture a movement.  I know bec I went in front of the camera.  It did not record.  
I’m so frustrated with this App.  Please fix it quick!

title: Buggy
text: I hope the Kuna folks fix this thing. My light/camera randomly disconnects and I can't get it to reconnect. It says it has a low signal when I'm standing right next to the light and it also says it has a low wifi signal and the light is located eight feet from my wireless router (I get a full wifi signal on my phone from the same location as the light). I really like the concept and the light. I hope they get the software figured out soon.

title: Happy with Product. App is Buggy
text: I have a WiFi Extender in my house; it’s older with a lot of walls. Before i installed the WiFi extender I received a lot of offline messages. After the extender, it’s been perfect!!!!!! If you buy one, invest in a WiFi extender especially if your modem is a good distance away from where you’re installing it.

title: Product is not reliable
text: I brought the Maximus Smart Security Light from Costco and it stopped working around 1 year with the bad WiFi component.  They send me the replacement (refurbished one), get it to install and work for about 90 days and the sensor stopped working.  I called and email customer service and they won’t replace with another unit because replacement unit only warranty for 90 days.  I would never buy or use any of their products.  It is not reliable and very bad customer support!

title: Great product!
text:
Had this for about a year now, got 6 mos. free subscription when I purchased At Costco ( gotta love Costco!).  
Don’t need the subscription, just need notification when someone is at the door, or package received.  Dies that perfectly!

title: Overall Very Pleased
text: I felt compelled to write this review to help balance the other reviews because this is truly an awesome product for the price. Figure you'll spend around $100 for a nice lamp and another $100 for a good outdoor camera, the price balances out since this camera is $150-$180 for Kuna depending on style. Now, this is the App Store so I'll quickly summarize the product, but not sure if other folks give it a bad rap due to "operator error" or maybe they just received faulty products. This camera is a breeze to set up and connect to wifi. It has a great wide angle and the functions work consistently; the app lets you adjust the sensitivity threshold and even after your free premium trial ends, assuming you live in a relatively safe area, you don't need to buy the monthly subscription (although at $4/month you can hardly complain if you want to subscribe). The app lets you download the clips of folks coming to your door (they only store on the app for so long so you want to download to be sure you save them) and record longer lengths up to 2 minutes of activity manually. I would like to see the ability to record to your own server in future models and not just their cloud service. The app has a few prerecorded messages which are fine (I do really really wish it let you pre-record your own) and they even put fun ones on there for holidays (Christmas, etc.). Occasionally if you aren't connected to strong wifi where you are, the camera signal strength cuts out but that's reasonable. Otherwise picture is clear and great for the price and audio is super sensitive (you could be 20+ feet away and still pick up some audio as I did just this afternoon). You can control light on/off settings, snooze settings, etc. Could the app be more powerful/feature loaded? Yes, absolutely, but again, for the price this is an awesome product and there aren't others offered like it. I'm in love with my kuna and definitely prefer it to the ring doorbell.

title: Bright idea, needs polish.
text:
I really like my Kuna, but there are a few things which keep me from loving it, and it has everything to do with the service and the software.
First, for a subscription to be worth it, it will have to use better discretion in issuing alerts. On a really windy day, I'll get a dozen alerts in a hour from the shadows cast by swaying tree branches or a potted plant alone. There is an option in settings to turn down the sensitivity, but if you dial that back too far, then it won't be triggered by the mailman. An algorithm which is able to distinguish human forms or faces would make it smarter than the average $20 motion detecting floodlight, and that would add crucial value to the device.

Secondly, maybe a premium subscription option would give the option to record constantly, and offer a log of motion-activated events before rolling it off of their servers after fifteen days or a month, just like professional surveillance systems do. I would consider that valuable because...

Thirdly, Kuna misses some trigger-worthy events. I'll sometimes walk right past it and get no notification, or the mailman won't set it off, and for a security service, that's kind of unsettling.

Fourth, the lag can be rough, especially when using the intercom. Often, I'll try to talk to people who come to my door with the intercom function, but by the time I've received a notification, they've already walked out of earshot.

Last, and this seems like the easiest fix, it doesn't work with my Bluetooth headphones. I have to assume that's the case with all BT speakers and Kuna's software, which is a rough deal for me, because I'm often in a high-noise environment, and that iPhone speaker is just not going to cut it.

All that having been said, I think the Kuna is a great concept, the camera is great, the feed is okay most of the time. If I had only one wish, it would be for the device to record directly to a storage device that is on-site for the end user. Of course, that would mean cutting Kuna away from the responsibilities of maintaining support for their cameras, but it would also mean cutting them out of potential subscription revenues.  So I can't see that happening. I just hope they can remain solvent for the life of this fixture, because without them, the hardware is pretty much worthless.

title: Love the Kuna cameras, and the app. Some areas for improvement
text:
We love our Kuna door cameras--we have three of them, plus several companion lights. They work amazingly well: the fact that they're wired into power means that, although you deal with some extra hassle at installation time, they're tidy and neat and reliably powered after that.  

We had Logitech Alert cameras (and the associated app) before the Kunas, and the Kuna experience is night-and-day better: much more reliable, higher video quality. 

There are a few areas for improvement that keep me from giving this 5 full stars, although it is a product I can recommend.

- First, while it's nice that there are Apple Watch notifications for the Kuna app (whenever motion is detected), it would be great if these contained the image that set off the motion detector. It's frustrating to have to pull out the phone to check whether it's a "false alarm" or not.

- Second, the motion detector itself could use some improvement. Sometimes it doesn't seem to notice motion, other times it fires with mere changes in lighting.  (I realize this is tough to get right, and it's nice the vendor provides a mechanism to set the sensitivity of the motion detection.)

- Finally, there's no HomeKit support in the current version of the hardware, and it doesn't seem likely there will be.  I understand that early adopters sometimes get left behind, but that doesn't make it less frustrating.

Still:  if you're looking for hard-wired (power) home security cameras, the Kuna is a great choice.  The app itself is solid, and getting even better with later releases.  We are very happy with our purchase, and can recommend these products.  With a few improvements (to Apple Watch support and motion detection)--this would easily be a 5-star product.

title: Unreliable product - 43% failure rate (3/7 failures) after 3 years
text:
Here is the summary of this message:  Kuna/Maximus makes an unreliable product that they don’t stand behind, and I’m going to post reviews on any site that will let me review your product, including the site where I bought them, and the Apple App Store.

The facts of my relationship with Kuna/Maximus:  I purchased quantity (5) Kuna smart security lights in March 2017 (see Amazon receipt attached .  October 2017, one of the lights failed and was replaced under warranty.  March 2020 a second light failure, and after refusing the “buy another” resolution proposed by Kuna customer support I was offered me a discounted refurbished unit which I purchased.  April 2020 my third light failure, and the "buy another" resolution was offered and adhered to.

Totals:

5 original units
+1 warranty replacement
+1 discounted replacement
7 total units
3 failures

3 failures out of 7 total lights = 42.8% failure rate.

Before you start with possible theories to make yourselves feel better, the lights were installed by a licensed electrician and were caulked with outdoor silicone between the structure and the light by him to further shed water.  I have a receipt and believe the lights were installed in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions.

After a brief failure analysis (I’m an engineer) I’ve discovered the following:

Housing:

The water shedding design of the Kuna smart security light housing is weak.  The speaker grille is NOT//NOT covered on the interior with a membrane, although the speaker does have a polymer grommet between the housing cover and the speaker.  The camera gimbal mount does NOT//NOT have gasketing or water prevention sealing.  The mounting post channels also do NOT//NOT have gasketing or sealing incorporated into the design.  These unsealed and unprotected openings will allow moisture to contact the electronics.

Electronics:

I was surprised, but then not surprised to find that NONE of the electronics or connectors were potted.  All that is between the electronics and the environment is the thin plastic housing, which is probably an ABS thermoplastic to improve injection molding efficiency at manufacturing.

Opinion:  While it is impossible for me to know the true motivations for Kuna/Maximus, I believe these lights are not intended to last and are designed to last just a little bit longer than the manufacturers warranty.  I’ve designed and installed outdoor electronics systems, and none with a 43% failure rate after 3 years.  Kuna is quick to offer a “buy another” solution instead of offering a product that is designed to last.  I will be purchasing no more products from Kuna/Maximus.

If I download them, the download is fast and the videos plays fine outside of the app. Overall, the app is good and has a nice interface but I'd really like to see it reach the same level of reliability as the Android counterpart.
